results.title: Interview
results.creator_credit: Caroline Leaf, Veronika Soul, David Verrall, Derek Lamb and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A freewheeling cinematic experience, this film is the work of two Canadian filmmakers, Caroline Leaf and Veronica Soul who relate their perceptions of each other through their respective animation techniques. Images and words are paired in startling associations. Each does a visual portrait of the other, based on characteristic gestures and impressions. A combination of techniques and materials, including live action, animation, photographs and drawings, produces a film of rich visual texture shaped by the hands and heads of two very different people. (Awards: Varna; Montreal; Grand Prix winner of Melbourne Film Festival 1980.)

results.title: Intersection collision
results.creator_credit: Amir M Karimi and University of California, Los Angeles. Media Center
results.brief_description: Provides information on intersection collision and on safety devices, and procedures that can reduce injuries. Discusses factors associated with door latch failure and motorist ejection, demonstrates the protection provided to motorists by the combined shoulder strap and lap belt, presents preliminary findings on tempered glass breakage, and illustrates car collision deformation and skid patterns.

results.title: Interscan MLS
results.brief_description: In the quest for an international standard Microwave Landing System for aircraft, Australia has developmed Interscan. The CSIRO Division of Radio Physics undertook this development using their knowledge and technology acquired by their pioneering research into radio astronomy. Filmed at Tullamarine Airport, Melbourne.

results.title: Interrogation and counsel
results.brief_description: This film raises for discussion some alternative police interrogation procedures and the rights of the accused to notification of their rights and, if necessary, to effective legal representation. The Fifth and Sixth Amendments to the American Bill of Rights are presented and related to two simulated cases.

results.title: Interregnum
results.creator_credit: Edward King, V.R. Sarma, George Movshon and United Nations Television
results.brief_description: Documents a particular example of United Nations co-operation during the takeover of West New Guinea (Irian Jaya) from the Dutch by the Indonesians. For a period of seven months, the United Nations Organization took over the responsibility for the running of the government of the country. This period marked an important development in the history of United Nations work towards international peace and understanding. Presented by Alistair Cooke.

results.title: Interpreting scientific data
results.creator_credit: Ken J. Widdowson and Educational Media Australia
results.brief_description: Presents a case study of a citrus orchard to allow students to interpret the results of an experiment based on scientific data supplied by a trained horticulturalist. Portrays science as a continuing process of inquiry.

results.title: Interpreters in education
results.brief_description: Provides an introduction for teachers to the work of interpreters in education. Stela Leonidas, a Greek interpreter, and Osman Ayyuce, a Turkish interpreter, take part in two parent/teacher interviews to show the work of interpreters in education.

results.title: Interpretations
results.creator_credit: Educational Film Studio and Film Polski
results.brief_description: This film looks at the creative process of painting as it is revealed in three individual painters. The three painters gather to look at a simple, traditional subject - a woman standing in a boat as the sun rises over the lake. From this we follow the individual creative process in each painter as he recreates the scene in his own imagination. Strikingly different in interpretation, each painting presents a valid statement of the artist’s vision of reality. No dialogue, english titles. (An edited version of the film “Interpretacle”.)

results.title: Interplanetary space
results.creator_credit: Bruce N. Gregory, Hugh Odishaw, Lothar Wolff and National Academy of Sciences (U.S.)
results.brief_description: Traces the development of space travel. Explains the importance of radar and radio astronomy in arriving at the conclusion about the activity of the Sun, its planets and some of the minor members of the solar system. considers them within the milieu of interplanetary space, a region now recognised to be an environment suffused with ionizing radiations, magnetic forces, gravitational influences, cosmic rays and the solar wind.
